skill.name: k8s-security-policies
skill.description: Implement Kubernetes security policies including NetworkPolicy, PodSecurityPolicy, and RBAC for production-grade security. Use when securing Kubernetes clusters, implementing network isolation, or enforcing pod security standards.
skill.summary: Implement Kubernetes security policies including NetworkPolicy, PodSecurityPolicy, and RBAC for prod...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill contains static markdown and YAML templates only. No executable code, network access, or data collection was detected.

content.value_statement: Kubernetes security policies are complex and easy to misconfigure. This skill provides clear templates and guidance for NetworkPolicy, RBAC, and Pod Security Standards.
actual_capabilities: Provide namespace label examples for Pod Security Standards
Offer NetworkPolicy templates for default deny and DNS egress
Show RBAC Role, ClusterRole, and RoleBinding examples
Include Gatekeeper ConstraintTemplate and Constraint examples
Document Istio mTLS and authorization policy examples
limitations: Does not apply policies to a live cluster
Does not validate policies against your CNI or admission tools
Does not generate custom manifests beyond provided templates
Does not audit existing RBAC or NetworkPolicy configurations

use_cases.title: Set namespace security labels
use_cases.description: Use baseline and restricted label templates for production namespaces.

use_cases.title: Create network segmentation
use_cases.description: Apply default deny and allow patterns for service to service traffic.

use_cases.title: Review RBAC scope
use_cases.description: Use RBAC patterns to reduce permissions and document access.

prompt_templates.title: Starter policies
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide baseline Pod Security Standards labels and a default deny NetworkPolicy for a production namespace.

prompt_templates.title: Allow DNS egress
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a NetworkPolicy that allows UDP 53 to kube-system while keeping default deny.

prompt_templates.title: Least privilege RBAC
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Role and RoleBinding that lets a service account read configmaps only.

prompt_templates.title: Gatekeeper enforcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Gatekeeper constraint template and constraint to require app and environment labels.

output_examples.input: Give me a safe default deny policy and allow DNS for a production namespace.
output: Default deny ingress and egress for all pods in the namespace
Allow UDP 53 egress to kube-system for DNS resolution
Note required namespace and label placeholders for customization

best_practices: Start with default deny network policies before adding allow rules
Use namespace scoped Roles when possible
Run pods as non root with a read only filesystem
anti_patterns: Granting wildcard verbs and resources in production RBAC
Allowing unrestricted egress to the public internet
Running privileged pods without a documented need

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Kubernetes versions?
faq.answer: It targets standard Kubernetes APIs and common add ons like Gatekeeper and Istio.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and guidance, but does not apply or validate policies.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitOps workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, the YAML examples can be stored and deployed with your GitOps tool.

faq.question: Does it access my cluster or data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides static guidance and does not connect to your systems.

faq.question: What if a policy does not work as expected?
faq.answer: Use the troubleshooting commands to check CNI support and RBAC permissions.

faq.question: How does this compare to a security scanner?
faq.answer: This is a guidance and template skill, not a scanning or compliance tool.
